text: The President of the Republic of Korea is the head of state, leader of the executive of the South Korean government and the commander-in-chief of the South Korean Armed Forces The president is directly elected by the people to a five-year term, with no possibility of re-election.Article 70 of the Constitution of the Republic of Korea. While in office, the chief executive lives in Cheong Wa Dae (the "Blue House"). If the National Assembly votes against a presidential decision, it will be declared void immediately. ==Powers and duties of the president== The president is required to: * uphold the Constitution * preserve the safety and homeland of South Korea * work for the peaceful reunification of Korea, typically act as the Chairperson of the National Unification Advisory Council ==List of presidents== ==Living former presidents== As of , four former presidents are alive: Image Name Term of office Age Lee Myung-bak 2008–2013 Park Geun-hye 2013–2017 Moon Jae-in 2017–2022 Yoon Suk Yeol 2022–2025 The longest-lived President was Yun Bo-seon, who died on July 18, 1990 (at the age of ). The most recent President to die was Chun Doo-hwan, who died on November 23, 2021. ==References== List of rules of South Korea ==Other websites== * Official Website of the President of the Republic of Korea Category:Lists of heads of state
